title: Can new Artistic Director Annilese Miskimmnon save English National Opera from mockery?
text:
After a run of duff productions, ENO needs a safe pair of hands – and Annilese Miskimmnon could be just the ticket, says Rupert Christiansen

After taking a big risk on Daniel Kramer and coming a cropper, English National Opera is playing it safe by appointing Annilese Miskimmnon as its new Artistic Director. Kramer (who left earlier this year) was noted for his flamboyance and desire to shock; Miskimmon represents a return to a steadier middle-of-the-road approach that will be welcomed by ENO’s core audience.

Hailing from Northern Ireland, a graduate of Cambridge, 45-year old Miskimmon has solid experience to offer: not only the direction of a good run of three or four-star productions for...
description: After a run of duff productions, ENO needs a safe pair of hands – and Annilese Miskimmnon could be just the ticket, says Rupert Christiansen
